intro: Pugiopappus bigelovii, commonly known as the bigelow's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sagebrush steppe and rocky soils. It has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
